results.title: The Pianist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal, Roman Polanski, Robert Benmussa and Alain Sarde
results.brief_description: An epic but true tale of the pianist Wladyslaw Szpilman’s struggle as a Polish Jew to survive World War II. Based on a book by Szpilman, Ronald Harwood’s Academy Award winning screenplay covers the period of the second World War. Roman Polanski’s skill in motion picture storytelling is evident here as he is also a winner of the Academy Award for Best Director. The film received seven nominations in all, most notably the Best Actor Award going to Adrien Brody for his portrayal of Szpilman. A gifted composer and pianist, Szpilman was making regular appearances on Polish radio when the Nazis overran Warsaw. His family are taken to the walled Ghetto where Szpilman is able to make a meagre living by playing piano in a cafe where the more affluent and sometimes corrupt Jewish people dine. He narrowly escapes the fate of his family’s trip to the death camps and survives with the help of friends and his own instinct and just pure willpower. A sympathetic German officer who is moved by his talent also spares and sustains his life. A moving portrayal of the plight of Polish Jews but one which also shows that there are good and bad people on every side during times of war. Special edition two-disc set including a thirty-minute documentary on the making of the film. Other Awards include the Palme D’Or at Cannes 2002. Cast includes Thomas Kretschmann.

results.title: The Physicists: playing dice with the universe
results.creator_credit: Document Associates, Philip S. Hobel, D Leiterman and Roger Hogen
results.brief_description: Describes the work of physicists as they experiment with ideas which few can comprehend. Tells how some are mapping the tiniest structures of matter, others are listening to the universe, hoping to discover intelligent life, and others are looking for black holes.

results.title: The Photographers
results.creator_credit: Time-Life Films, Christine Huneke and Jerry Sims
results.brief_description: Five of America’s top professional still photographers are seen here on assignments around the world. Includes Larry Burrows, Alfred Eisenstaedt, Mary Ellen Mark, John Dominis and Norman Parkinson.

results.title: The Photographer
results.creator_credit: Affiliated Film Producers and Willard Van Dyke
results.brief_description: The life and work of the American photographer, Edward Weston. The artist is shown at work in California; shows the manner in which Mr Weston approaches his selection of material for pictorial composition and techniques he uses for developing the print. The film includes glimpses of the home of the artist and studies of the sea and mountain landscape of California. Commentary by Irving Jacoby. Narrated by Mel Brandt.

results.title: The Photographer
results.brief_description: A whimsical sketch of a photographer in a small community, whose livelihood comes from understanding, and flattering, people’s vanities. As it presents a sampling of one day’s appointments, the film pokes gentle fun at the parade of human nature that passes before a photographer’s lens. Writen by Norman Klenman, photographed by Lorne C. Batchelor, narrated by William Hutt.

results.title: The Photo conductive effect
results.creator_credit: Katrina Rank, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, Frank A. Hoare and David Cons
results.brief_description: Shows how the photo-conductive cell is highly sensitive to infra-red radiation. Illustrates various methods of detecting and measuring such radiation; history of research into the photo-conductive effect - Willoughby Smith’s experiments and Adam’s and Day’s work; composition of a photo-conductive cell and its working; the distance in spectral response curve between the different substances; operation of guided missiles, steel furnaces, and medical analysis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Katrina Rank, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, Frank A. Hoare and David Cons

results.title: The Philippines: island republic
results.brief_description: The Philippines is a multi-island republic, with about half of its 7000 islands inhabited. Under the colonial rule of the United States, the democratic system of government was introduced, universal public education, and an all-weather road system. Reviews the agriculture, and economy of the islands and points out the relative prosperity.

results.title: The Phase contrast microscope [Silent]
results.creator_credit: B Troughton + Simms Ltd and G.G. Grand
results.brief_description: Explains the properties of light and image formation in a normal microscope, and the effect of the Zernike disc in transforming changes in wave phase into changes in amplitudes to phase-contrast microscope is shown in use, with some examples of images invisible by normal miscroscopy.

results.title: The Phantom. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Rudolph C. Flothow and B Reeves Eason
results.brief_description: Episodes eleven to fifteen. Originally a comic-strip character written by Lee Falk and drawn by Ray Moore, This popular serial featured Tom Tyler as The Ghost Who Walks and Ace the Wonder Dog as Devil. Faithful to the original strip, in the first episode The Phantom is killed by the evil Dr. Bremmer and his equally evil henchmen. As the story continues, we see his son (Tyler) adopting his father’s costume and perpetuating the myth that The Phantom is back from the dead. Eventually scientists (evil) try to kill The Phantom for good so they can take the Lost City of Zoloz and replace The Phantom with an imposter to trick the natives into slavery. Will The Phantom survive? Will the natives succumb to evil? Cast includes: Kenneth R. MacDonald, Frank Shannon, Jeanne Bates, Guy Kingsford, Joe Devlin, Ernie Adams, John Bagni.
